member.userdoc: The size of one edge of the box.

member.userdoc: The offset with the real graphic mesh.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.BoxColliderShapeDesc.LocalRotation
member.userdoc: The local rotation of the collider shape.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.CapsuleColliderShapeDesc.Is2D
member.userdoc: Select this if this shape will represent a 2D shape

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.CapsuleColliderShapeDesc.Length
member.userdoc: The length of the capsule (distance between the center of the two sphere centers).

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.CapsuleColliderShapeDesc.Radius
member.userdoc: The radius of the capsule.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.CapsuleColliderShapeDesc.Orientation
member.userdoc: The orientation of the capsule.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.CapsuleColliderShapeDesc.LocalOffset
member.userdoc: The offset with the real graphic mesh.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.CapsuleColliderShapeDesc.LocalRotation
member.userdoc: The local rotation of the collider shape.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.ConvexHullColliderShapeDesc.Model
member.userdoc: Model asset from where the engine will derive the convex hull.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.ConvexHullColliderShapeDesc.LocalOffset
member.userdoc: The offset with the real graphic mesh.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.ConvexHullColliderShapeDesc.LocalRotation
member.userdoc: The local rotation of the collider shape.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.ConvexHullColliderShapeDesc.SimpleWrap
member.userdoc: If this is checked the following parameters are totally ignored, as only a simple convex hull of the whole model will be generated.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.ConvexHullColliderShapeDesc.Scaling
member.userdoc: The scaling of the generated convex hull.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.ConvexHullColliderShapeDesc.Depth
member.userdoc: Control how many sub convex hulls will be created, more depth will result in a more complex decomposition.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.ConvexHullColliderShapeDesc.PosSampling
member.userdoc: How many position samples to internally compute clipping planes ( the higher the more complex ).

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.ConvexHullColliderShapeDesc.AngleSampling
member.userdoc: How many angle samples to internally compute clipping planes ( the higher the more complex ), nested with position samples, for each position sample it will compute the amount defined here.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.ConvexHullColliderShapeDesc.PosRefine
member.userdoc: If higher then 0 the computation will try to further improve the shape position sampling (this will slow down the process).

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.ConvexHullColliderShapeDesc.AngleRefine
member.userdoc: If higher then 0 the computation will try to further improve the shape angle sampling (this will slow down the process).

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.ConvexHullColliderShapeDesc.Alpha
member.userdoc: Applied to the concavity during crippling plane approximation.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.ConvexHullColliderShapeDesc.Threshold
member.userdoc: Threshold of concavity, rising this will make the shape simpler.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.CylinderColliderShapeDesc.Height
member.userdoc: The height of the cylinder

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.CylinderColliderShapeDesc.Radius
member.userdoc: The radius of the cylinder

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.CylinderColliderShapeDesc.Orientation
member.userdoc: The orientation of the cylinder.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.CylinderColliderShapeDesc.LocalOffset
member.userdoc: The offset with the real graphic mesh.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.CylinderColliderShapeDesc.LocalRotation
member.userdoc: The local rotation of the collider shape.

member.name: M:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.CharacterComponent.Move(SiliconStudio.Core.Mathematics.Vector3)
member.summary: Moves the character towards the specified movement vector. Motion will stay in place unless modified or canceled passing Vector3.Zero.
member.param: The velocity vector, typically direction * delta time `var dt = this.GetSimulation().FixedTimeStep;` * speed.

member.name: M:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.CharacterComponent.SetVelocity(SiliconStudio.Core.Mathematics.Vector3)
member.summary: Sets the character velocity. Velocity will be applied every frame unless modified or canceled passing Vector3.Zero.
member.remarks: The engine internally will multiply velocity with the simulation fixed time step.
member.param: The velocity vector, typically direction * speed.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.Simulation.MaxSubSteps
member.summary: The maximum number of steps that the Simulation is allowed to take each tick. If the engine is running slow (large deltaTime), then you must increase the number of maxSubSteps to compensate for this, otherwise your simulation is “losing” time. It's important that frame DeltaTime is always less than MaxSubSteps*FixedTimeStep, otherwise you are losing time.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.Simulation.FixedTimeStep
member.summary: By decreasing the size of fixedTimeStep, you are increasing the “resolution” of the simulation. Default is 1.0f / 60.0f or 60fps

member.name: E:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.Simulation.SimulationEnd
member.summary: Called right after the physics simulation. This event might not be fired by the main thread.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.StaticPlaneColliderShape.#ctor(SiliconStudio.Core.Mathematics.Vector3,System.Single)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. A static plane that is solid to infinity on one side. Several of these can be used to confine a convex space in a manner that completely prevents tunneling to the outside. The plane itself is specified with a normal and distance as is standard in mathematics.

member.summary: 3D only

member.summary: 3D and 2D

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.ConstraintTypes.Point2Point
member.summary: The translation vector of the matrix to create this will represent the pivot, the rest is ignored

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.ConstraintTypes.Gear
member.summary: The translation vector of the matrix to create this will represent the axis, the rest is ignored

member.name: T:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.ContactPoint
member.summary: Generic contact between colliders, Always using Vector3 as the engine allows mixed 2D/3D contacts. Note: As class because it is shared between the 2 Colliders.. maybe struct is faster?

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.ContactPointEqualityComparer.Default
member.summary: Gets the default.

member.name: T:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.HitResult
member.summary: The result of a Physics Raycast or ShapeSweep operation

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.HitResult.Collider
member.summary: The collider hit by the

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.HitResult.FullLength
member.summary: used to compute NormalizedDistance

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.RigidBodyTypes.Static
member.summary: They are supposed to never move, they are not automatically updated by the engine. They can be moved tho by an explicit call to UpdateTransformation(), results are not realist for dynamic simulation so use it wisely. If you plan to move the entity it is advised to use Kinematic, which allows the normal dynamic simulation.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.RigidBodyTypes.Dynamic
member.summary: The Physics engine is the authority for this kind of rigidbody, you should move them using forces and/or impulses, never directly editing the Transformation

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Physics.RigidBodyTypes.Kinematic
member.summary: You can move this kind of rigidbody around and the physics engine will interpolate and perform dynamic interactions with dynamic bodies Notice that there is no dynamic interaction with static and other kinematic bodies

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Engine.PhysicsComponent.ColliderShapes
member.userdoc: The reference to the collider Shape of this element.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Engine.PhysicsComponent.CollisionGroup
member.summary: Gets or sets the collision group.
member.userdoc: The collision group of this element, default is DefaultFilter. Cannot change during run-time.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Engine.PhysicsComponent.CanCollideWith
member.summary: Gets or sets the can collide with.
member.userdoc: Which collider groups this element can collide with, when nothing is selected it will collide with all groups. Cannot change during run-time.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Engine.PhysicsComponent.ProcessCollisions
member.summary: Gets or sets if this element will store collisions
member.userdoc: Unchecking this will help with performance, ideally if this entity has no need to access collisions information should be set to false

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Engine.PhysicsComponent.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets if this element is enabled in the physics engine
member.userdoc: If this element is enabled in the physics engine

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Engine.PhysicsComponent.CanSleep
member.summary: Gets or sets if this element can enter sleep state
member.userdoc: If this element can enter sleep state and skip physics simulation while sleeping

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Engine.PhysicsComponent.IsActive
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance is active (awake).
member.value: true if this instance is active; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Engine.PhysicsComponent.Activate(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Attempts to awake the collider.

member.name: P:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Engine.PhysicsComponent.Restitution
member.summary: Gets or sets if this element restitution
member.userdoc: This element restitution (can create bounce effects)

member.summary: Gets or sets the friction of this element
member.userdoc: The friction of this element

member.summary: Gets or sets the rolling friction of this element
member.userdoc: The rolling friction of this element

member.summary: Gets or sets the tag.

member.summary: Computes the physics transformation from the TransformComponent values

member.name: M:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Engine.PhysicsComponent.DeriveBonePhysicsTransformation(SiliconStudio.Core.Mathematics.Matrix@)
member.summary: Computes the physics transformation from the TransformComponent values

member.name: M:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Engine.PhysicsComponent.UpdateTransformationComponent(SiliconStudio.Core.Mathematics.Matrix@)
member.summary: Updades the graphics transformation from the given physics transformation

member.name: M:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Engine.PhysicsComponent.UpdateBoneTransformation(SiliconStudio.Core.Mathematics.Matrix@)
member.summary: Updades the graphics transformation from the given physics transformation

member.name: M:SiliconStudio.Xenko.Engine.PhysicsComponent.UpdatePhysicsTransformation
member.summary: Forces an update from the TransformComponent to the Collider.PhysicsWorldTransform. Useful to manually force movements. In the case of dynamic rigidbodies a velocity reset should be applied first.

member.name: T:SiliconStudio.XenkoVersion
member.summary: Internal version used to identify Xenko version.
member.remarks: Note: When modifying the version here, it must be modified also in the Xenko.xkpkg

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.XenkoVersion.CurrentAssemblyAsText
member.summary: The .NET current assembly version as text, not including pre-release (alpha, beta...) information.

member.name: F:SiliconStudio.XenkoVersion.CurrentAsText
member.summary: The Store current version as text, including pre-release (alpha, beta...) information
member.remarks: Version number as described in http://docs.nuget.org/docs/reference/versioning When using pre-release (alpha, beta, rc...etc.) and because the order of the release is in alphabetical order, please use a double digit like alpha00 alpha01...etc. in order to make sure that we will follow the correct order for the versions.
